definition: dry rations (for a journey)/(dialect) (of noodles etc) to become mush (from overcooking)/(coll.) embarrassing/embarrassment
nothing but herb soup and dry provisions to eat (idiom); to survive on a coarse diet/à la guerre comme à la guerre
nothing but herb soup and dry provisions to eat (idiom); to survive on a coarse diet/à la guerre comme à la guerre
lit. to live on dry provisions and wild herbs (idiom)/fig. to live in abject poverty

sentences.english: Jordan also had several affairs while married and numerous gambling problems.
sentences.chinese: 乔丹也在婚姻和赌博方面不停地有糗事冒出。
或是伊莱恩的工作糗事。

sentences.english: I was so humiliated when I called our client by the wrong name.
sentences.chinese: 当我叫错我客户的名字时，我真是超糗的。

sentences.english: Will, She's been dead for 2 years, and that's the shit I remember.
sentences.chinese: 威尔，她去世两年了，我记得的却是她的糗事。

sentences.english: I wouldn’t mind whooping your butt in a few rounds of Street Fighter.
sentences.chinese: 我可不介意绕街几圈然后喊出你的糗事。

sentences.english: What will happen when he visits the dentist?
sentences.chinese: 当他去看牙医时会发生什么糗事？

sentences.english: His check bounced, leaving Jim behind the eight ball with his landlord.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆这会儿对房东糗了，因为他付给房东支票跳票了。

sentences.english: You'll remember Bass Ackwards. We've all been there.
sentences.chinese: 大家会记住《贝斯糗事》的，因为大家都经历过。

sentences.english: Las Vegas has been the location for many of Britney's infamous moments.
sentences.chinese: 拉斯维加斯堪称布兰妮的“糗事”多发地。

definition: (archaic) light, bright (variant of 冏[jiong3])/(since c. 2005) (slang) emoticon signifying embarrassment, shock, helplessness etc
social gaffe or blunder/faux pas/see 出洋相[chu1 yang2 xiang4]
to make a fool of oneself
shameful/scandalous/to be humiliated/to make a fool of sb or oneself/to make sb lose face
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
